humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states 'Histopathological diagnosis: Carcinoma ductale invasivum mammae sinistrae (NHG2, pT2, pNO)', which indicates that there are no positive lymph nodes (pNO). This matches with the definitions provided in Rules 2, 8, 10, and 11, which all state that N0 indicates no metastatic carcinoma in lymph nodes or that all assessed lymph nodes are negative for metastatic carcinoma.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions that the axillary lymph nodes were removed without any signs of tumor involvement (lymphonodulitis chronica, pNO). This indicates that there is no evidence of cancer in the lymph nodes, which corresponds to an N0 stage.
